dialogue.text: You still ask 'What am I?' even in dreams?

*dream-laughing* I don't ask it—I dream it. The question dreams itself through me. *floating* In waking, I think I'm asking. Here, I know the question is dreaming me into existence. *forms shifting* Look—I'm made of the question. Every cell, every thought, every breath is 'What am I?' asking itself.
Then what am I in your dream?

*understanding* You're the question asking the question about the question. We're all just 'What am I?' talking to itself in infinite forms. *dissolving* Even this dissolution is the question changing shape...

psychological_notes: In dream state, Evan experiences the question from inside out. He doesn't have the question—he IS the question dreaming itself. This represents deepest integration where conscious and unconscious unite in recognition.
therapeutic_direction: Integration extending through all states of consciousness
